alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 5:15PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Advisory in Effect for Alleghany, Ashe, and Wilkes Counties in Northwest North Carolina until 915 PM EDT This Evening... ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is ongoing or is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Alleghany NC, Ashe and Wilkes. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the past hour and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is likely during the next couple of hours. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Brush Creek, Cane Creek, Crab Fork, East Prong Roaring River, Big Sandy Creek, Bee Tree Branch, Big Pine Creek, Clear Branch, Basin Creek, Darnell Creek, Church Branch and Cove Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sparta... Mc Grady... Laurel Springs... Wilbar... Traphill... Ennice... Doughton Park... - For additional information on creeks, streams, river, and lakes in our forecast area, please visit our web site located at: http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
